sect1.title: EXCEPT
sect1.para: fields A comma-delimited list of data fields in a RECORD structure.

The EXCEPT keyword EXCEPT keyword specifies a list of fields not to use in a SORT, GROUP, DEDUP, or ROLLUP operation. This allows you to perform the operation on all fields in the RECORD EXCEPT those fields you name, making the code more readable and maintainable.
sect1.programlisting:
x := DATASET([{'Taylor','Richard','Jackson' ,'M'}, {'Taylor','David' ,'Boca' ,'M'}, {'Taylor','Rita' ,'Boca' ,'F'}, {'Smith' ,'Richard','Mansfield','M'}, {'Smith' ,'Oscar' ,'Boca' ,'M'}, {'Smith' ,'Rita' ,'Boca' ,'F'}], {STRING10 lname, STRING10 fname, STRING10 city, STRING1 sex }); y := SORT(x,EXCEPT sex); //sort on all fields but sex
OUTPUT(y)
sect1.para: See Also: SORT, GROUP, DEDUP, ROLLUP
